title: Top Gear, episode 5, review: vroom for improvement in final episode
text:
Chris Harris was very clear about the job descriptions on Top Gear (BBC Two). “You were hired to be the psycho, crazy, I’ll-do-anything guy,” he told colleague Freddie Flintoff. “That’s not my role. I’m supposed to bring it back to the cars.”

The centrepiece of this fifth and final episode was fearless Flintoff’s trip to Iceland to compete in Formula Off Road, the world's most outrageous motorsport. Harris, there to act as his mentor, called it “an automotive torture chamber of near-vertical cliffs and punishing off-road sprints”.

The last laugh was on Harris, however, when he was forced to compete himself. Cue a spectacular sequence of sheer climbs through volcanic landscapes, cars flying through...
